definition: to tend a flock of sheep/to let sheep out to pasture/fig. to throw off the reins/to leave sb alone/acting freely and irresponsibly
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Nahor, you shall be punished by tending to the sheep for Abram and Haran.
sentences.chinese: 纳曷尔，你被罚替亚伯兰和哈兰放羊。

sentences.english: "We herded sheep on Brokeback one summer, " said Ennis.
sentences.chinese: “有一年夏天，我们在断背山上放羊”安尼斯说。

sentences.english: Once upon a time a shepherd Boy was wandering far from home.
sentences.chinese: 从前，一个放羊娃到离家很远的地方去玩。

sentences.english: The shepherd pastured his sheep on the village common.
sentences.chinese: 羊倌在村庄的公地上放羊。

sentences.english: Sheep follow the shepherd into the village.
sentences.chinese: 羊跟着放羊的转进村庄。

sentences.english: The old man was pasturing his sheep on the village common .
sentences.chinese: 老人在村庄的公地上放羊。

sentences.english: Stefano used a motor cycle to herd the sheep.
sentences.chinese: 斯特凡诺骑一辆摩托车放羊。

sentences.english: As far as we know, all Jacob's sons were shepherds.
sentences.chinese: 据我们所知，雅各的儿子都是放羊的。

definition: to mow grass/haymaking/to write a rough draft (of an essay etc)
